El nacimiento de una obra de arte.

Half-Life is a unique game compared to a lot of what's the standard for games. Half-Life is more than just some first person shooter with physics puzzles, it's a story told through the eyes of a man who has to fix the mistakes he's made, and over the time he's been granted the opportunity of life to save the world from an alien overrule throughout HL2. Honestly, the game is so much better than what I see from most games i've played regarding the FPS genre. The game is fun and the puzzles are challenging, and I tend to have a bad habit of getting lost in some areas only to find out it was right there in front of me. But needless to say the game is absolutely spectacular and even if you, yourself, aren't a MIT graduate of theoretical physics, cause that's just what a game really needs, some brain power for survivability.

Este tÃ­tulo, como otros First Person Shooters les tengo bastante cariÃ±o por la nostalgia y los buenos momentos que me dio. Cuando jugaba a esta entrega, me pegaba mucho a los servidores online que siempre era divertido jugar un "Todos contra todos". Ahora que, aparte de jugar en los servidores de Half-Life, he llegado a completar el modo historia, debo decir que, a pesar de ser bastante lineal, lo recomiendo bastante. No es que sea la octava maravilla del mundo, pero tiene una buena historia. En cuanto al apartado del armamento pues debo admitir que tiene mucho para ofrecer (siendo que este juego saliÃ³ en 1998), como por ejemplo: el rifle, la ballesta, la escopeta, el caÃ±Ã³n Tau, la pistola de gluones, entre otras. Si bien hay servidores online en los que aÃºn hay gente que juega, no son muchos realmente, asÃ­ que en ese punto no les recomendarÃ­a del todo.
En resumidas cuentas: un clÃ¡sico de los videojuegos, que resalta mucho por su innovaciÃ³n en los FPS, con mucho detalle para la Ã©poca, y que a fuerza debes probar.

8/10

22 years later and this game definitely holds up. The areas you explore, the different paths and puzzles for you to find and solve, it is simply amazing. The story is subtle but keeps you going, and as you inch closer and closer to the end, the game gets way more tense and suspenseful. G-Man has to be such a puzzling yet well made character, as you realize that he is involved so much more than we see, and the ending with him was simply amazing. I'd recommend this game to anyone who is remotely interested in playing. This game was way ahead of it's time, the models for NPCs and guns would of blown my mind, as well as the areas you get to see, the enemies you fight, truly remarkable.
good music. good challenge. amazing story and well told
Half Life is one of the best game. Just try and you will see.
very very good game i recommend it very much.

I love this game. It is fun whether you want a fast-paced shooter game or if you want to take a more careful, slower and more stealthy approach. All weapons have their purpose, and their balance.
The music, when it appears, creates the atmosphere, and it does it so well that most players may say they didn't even notice there was music. The levels, though, are immersive enough by themselves.

You know this game. It's Valve's first title, and, in my opinion, the best (excluding Half-Life: Alyx, because I haven't played it). Get it.

I first played Half-Life in the early 2000's and actually never recall beating it until now. I would usually get to XEN and get frustrated with the platforming. The game is certainly showing it's age despite how revolutionary it was for the time. This is probably an unpopular opinion, but if you're one of the few that hasn't played this yet, play Black Mesa instead. They did a great job and I think it makes a suitable replacement for the original in terms of the overall experience and it makes a smoother transition into HL2. Otherwise, still a good game for it's time and worth collecting on the cheap.

A half-life usually describes the decay of discrete entities, such as radioactive atoms. In that case, it does not work to use the definition that states "half-life is the time required for exactly half of the entities to decay". For example, if there is just one radioactive atom, and its half-life is one second, there will not be "half of an atom" left after one second.

Instead, the half-life is defined in terms of probability: "Half-life is the time required for exactly half of the entities to decay on average". In other words, the probability of a radioactive atom decaying within its half-life is 50%
Gordon got dem ice shoes tho.

Don't let the age of the game deter you trying the first game in this well reputed franchise, it holds up well and  it is quite fun with surprising depth to the combat. There are one or two sections where the game feels like it drags it's heels a bit but the good far outweighs the bad.
